condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement: Schedule 2, Section II, B. 2 | Description :Recipient shall cause Project State toprepare and submit IFRs to the Association within 45 days after the end of each quarter. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement: Schedule 2, Section II A. | Description :Recipient shall cause Project State to mon. &eval. prgrs & prep. Project Reports (PR) to the Association. PR covers period of 6 months & submit to Association within 45 daysafter end period. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement: Schedule 2, Section II, B. 3 | Description :Recipient will have Fin.Statemts audited &each to cover the period of one FY commencing in yr. first withdrawal was made. FSs submitted to Association not later than 6 mthsafter end of period. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement: Schedule, Section II, A. 1 | Description :Project Reports prepared by Project State covering6 month periods of the FY and submitted to Association no later than 45 days after the end of period. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement: Schedule, Section II, A. 3 | Description :Mid Term Review jointly carried out with theProject State & Association no later than thirty months after the Effective Date. | Due Date :28-Feb-2013

Finance Agreement :Project Agreement: Schedule, Section II, B. 2 | Description :Proj. Financial Statements (FS) to be audited byindependent auditors accept. to Association. FSs to cover each FY of Recip. and submitted to Association within 6 mnths after endof period. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Information regarding project is distributed widely to all 1000 participating GPs by EOP
By EOP, minimum of 80% of 1000 GPs have well functioning fiduciary and planning systems in place
A performance based grant transfer system is well established to roll out to other GPs
State Government Oversight and Monitoring of PRIs ( Component 3): The performance of 100% of targeted GPs is assessed each year
Three Thematic evaluations or studies are completed by EOP
Project Management and Implementation ( Component 4 ) : Project Coordination Cells at the state and district levels are functioningto provide suport and oversight to GPs.
By EOP, detailed reports on GP investments are available for 80% of targeted GPs
Minimum of 2 GP operating system areas ( planning and GPMS) are improved
Capacity Builidng GPs ( Component 2) : Minimum of 2000 GPs trained over life of the project
Number of project beneficiaries of which x% are female
Grant to GPs(Component 1) By EOP,80% of GPs(800) receive annual grants after passing performance assessments
